title: Cat. 127  Horse with Other Animals and Ornaments, 1899/1900
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Horse with Other Animals and Ornaments  
1899/1900  
Wood-block print in black ink on cream wove paper; 235 × 253 mm (image and sheet, max.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Mrs. Carl O. Schniewind, 1959.38  
Kornfeld 74 II/II  
For the verso, see fig. 127.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Given by Mrs. Carl O. Schniewind, Chicago, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1959.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 258–59, cat. 74 (ill.)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed in wood block, center, printed in black ink: P / G

Inscribed lower center, in graphite: Gauguin Untitled compo. with horse facing L. Gift of Mrs. Carl O. Schniewind / not in G.

Inscribed lower right, in graphite: X2790 / 59.38

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">In the collection of Carl O. Schniewind by April 15, 1954 according to invoice from appraiser Benjamin K. Smith, Chicago, photocopy in curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 127 Horse with Other Animals and Ornaments, 1899/1900.

fig. 127.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Horse with Other Animals and Ornaments (1899/1900). The Art Institute of Chicago, 1959.38.

</section>
